Correspondece from Evelyn C. Robertson Jr to Dr. Carroll Van West informing him of the Allen-White School burning

The Allen-White School was built 1918-1920 with support of the Julius Rosenwald Fund. When the school closed, the building was acquired by a non-profit organization associated with ElCanaan Missionary Baptist Church. The building then was destroyed by arson in May of 2012.

ELCANAAN COMMUNITY HELP ORGANIZATION (ECHO) P. 0. Box 327 Whiteville, TN 38075 Dr. Carroll Van West, Director The Center for Historic Preservation MTSU Box80 Murfreesboro, TN 37132 Dear Dr. Van West: I regret to inform you of a very unfortunate event on the site of the former Allen-White School in Whiteville, Sunday Morning May 20, 2012 at approximately 2:30A.M. a fire completely destroyed the structure that was the Rosenwald Building on the Allen-White Campus. It is obvious that Arson is the cause since there has been no electricity to the building in recent years. As you can imagine this is devastating to the community and those interested in the preservation and restoration of the property. I am enclosing a picture of the burning which is part of a flyer announcing a reward for information about the incident. I know that we are on your itinerary for August in Whiteville; however this incident totally alters the tenor of our discussion. I hope that this does not alter your plans and that you and staff may provide some advice/consultation regar9ing future direction. As you can see from the picture the destruction is massive. Any advice in the interim would be welcomed. Thanks for your interest. Sincere regards, Evelyn C. Robertson, Jr.
